titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Her Papers, 1854-1988 and undated, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: Abel Ramirez

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Dorothy Rylander Papers, 1854-1988 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The papers of Dorothy Rylander, who was a former assistant to Congressman George H. Mahon from 1946 to 1953, and an administrative assistant to William C. Holden at the West Texas Museum from 1953 until retiring in 1971.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: A former assistant to Congressman George H. Mahon, a historian, and a genealogist, Dorothy Rylander was born in 1909 in Belton, Texas, and moved to Lubbock, Texas, in 1918. She received her B.A. in history from Texas Technological College in 1930 and her M.A. in 1931. From 1932 to 1946, she worked as a faculty secretary in the College of Engineering at Texas Technological College. Rylander also served as an assistant to Congressman George H. Mahon from 1946 to 1953, and as an administrative assistant to William C. Holden at the West Texas Museum from 1953 until retiring in 1971. She was also involved in the South Plains Genealogical Society, the Lubbock County Historical Survey Committee, the Lubbock Cultural Affairs Council, the Lubbock Heritage Society, Friends of the Lubbock Library, and Pathfinders, an organization that recognizes the contribution of women in early Lubbock history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of scrapbook material and printed material. It bulks (1938-1988) with material about West Texas and the Lubbock area in the form of newspaper clippings and scrapbook material. Of particular interest is Rylander's political scrapbook material concerning Franklin D. Roosevelt, Harry S. Truman, George Mahon, and Sam Rayburn. Additionally, the collection contains scrapbook material pertaining to the Texas Centennial (1936).

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Persons)
controlaccess.persname: Mahon, George Herman, 1900-1985--Career in politics and government
Rayburn, Sam, 1882-1961--Career in politics and government

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dorothy Rylander Papers, 1854-1988 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas
